page.title: 07WESTGATE ABBATOIR
page.content:
In Westgate at High Town there is an abattoir. It has been a slaughter house since 1961. Sheep and cattle are killed. They come from Nattrass' Council farm at Daddry Shield and from the fat cattle mart. Cattle are killed by running them in to a cattle crush, lowering a bar on to their heads and shooting them. To kill the sheep you have to lie them on a table, tie their legs together and shoot them in the head. Three people work there.
There is also a butchers shop at the abattoir. Customers come from all over the North East of England.They once had a travelling butchers van but now people phone in and collect their orders or have the meat delivered.
